data.title: [BERKELEY, Edmund C.]. -- ALT, Franz L. "NBS computation laboratory. National Bureau of Standards Technical Report 1481." Mimeographed typescript. Washington, D.C.: National Bureau of Standards, n.d.
data.meta_description: [BERKELEY, Edmund C.]. -- ALT, Franz L. "NBS computation laboratory. National Bureau of Standards Technical Report 1481." Mimeographed typescript. Washington, D.C.: National Bureau of Standards, n.d. [1950?]. Unbound as issued. OOC 424. -- ALT, ed. Advances in computers. Volume 1 [only]. New York & London: Academic Press, 1960. Original red cloth, green printed dust-jacket. OOC 425. -- ASSOCIATION FOR COMPUTING MACHINERY. Proceedings  ... jointly sponsored by the Association for Computing Machinery and the University of Toronto, September 8-10, 1952. Washington, D.C.: Sauls Lithograph Company for the Association for Computing Machinery, 1952. Original printed wrappers; boxed. OOC 440. -- BERKELEY. Conditions affecting the application of symbolic logic. Offprint from Journal of Symbolic Logic 7, no. 4 (December 1942). Original gray printed wrappers. OCC 458. PRESENTATION COPY. -- BERKELEY. Giant brains or machines that think. New York: Science Editions, 1961. Original pictorial soft covers. OOC 464. -- BERKELEY. "Simple Simon." In Scientific American 183 (November 1950): 40-43. Original pictorial wrappers. OOC 466. -- BERKELEY and JENSEN, Robert A. Constructing electric brains. New York: Edmund C. Berkeley and Associates, 1952. Loose-leaf photo-offset, holes punched in left margin. Original gray printed wrappers. OOC 467. -- BERKELEY and KOFF, Jack. Squee, the robot squirrel -- construction plans. New York: Edmund C. Berkeley and Associates, August 1952. Photo-offset. Original printed self-wrappers. OOC 468. -- BERKELEY. Numbles: Number puzzles for nimble minds. Newtonville, Mass.: Edmund C. Berkeley and Associates, 1954. Original printed self-wrappers. OOC 470. -- BERKELEY and JENSEN, Robert A. Construction plans for Simon. New York: Edmund C. Berkeley and Associates, August 1955. Original printed self-wrappers. OOC 471. -- BERKELEY. Small robots -- report. Newtonville, Mass.: Berkeley Enterprises, April 1956. Unbound. OOC 472. -- BERKELEY. The construction of living robots. Newtonville, Mass.: Berkeley Enterprises, August 1956. Unbound. OOC 473. -- BERKELEY. "Relay Moe plays tick tack toe." In Radio-Electronics 27 (December 1956): 50-52. Whole number. Original printed wrappers. OOC 474. -- BERKELEY and WAINWRIGHT, Lawrence. Computers: Their operation and applications. New York: Reinhold Publishing Corporation, [1957]. Original green cloth, dust-jacket. OOC 475. -- BERKELEY. Symbolic logic and intelligent machines. New York: Reinhold Publishing Corporation, 1959. Original dark red cloth, dust-jacket. OOC 476. -- BERKELEY. List of references to computer literature. Newtonville, Mass.: Berkeley Enterprises, Ltd, October 1959. Unbound. OOC 477. -- BERKELEY. Brainiacs: 201 small electric brain machines, and how to make them, including all 33 original circuits (1955), all 13 Tyniacs (1956) and 155 Brainiacs (1957-1958-1959). Newtonville, Mass.: Berkeley Enterprises, 1961. Original blue printed wrappers. OOC 478. -- BERKELEY. The computer revolution. Garden City, N.Y.: Doubleday, 1962. Original greenish yellow cloth, pictorial dust-jacket. OOC 479. -- [BERKELEY]. Make over 70 teaching machines  programmed learning machines  computing, reasoning, puzzle-solving and game-playing machines with our teaching machine, programmed learning, and automatic teaching computer kit K33. Newtonville, Mass.: Berkeley Enterprises, Inc, n.d. [1963?] Unbound circular. OOC 480. -- [BERKELEY.] Make over 70 teaching machines, programmed learning machines, computing, reasoning, puzzle-solving and game-playing machines with our teaching machine and programmed learning aid automatic teaching computer kit K33. Newtonville, Mass.: Berkeley Enterprises, Inc, n.d. [1963?] Unbound circular. OOC 481. -- BERKELEY. Teaching machines, programmed learning, and automatic teaching computers: An introduction through experiments. Newton, Mass.: Berkeley Enterprises, 1963, 1964. Original red printed wrappers. OOC 482. -- BERKELEY. Computer-assisted explanation: A guide to explaining: and some ways of using a computer to assist in clear explanation. Cambridge, Mass.: Information International, May 1967. Original blue printed wrappers. OOC 484. -- [BERKELEY]. "Memorial service for Edmund Callis Berkeley March 20, 1909 to March 7, 1988." Service held at Newton Cemetery Chapel, 719 Walnut St. Newton, MA, March 26, 1988. Photo-offset typescript, stapled. OOC 485. -- DIGITAL EQUIPMENT CORPORATION. PDP-7 programming manual symbolic assembler. Maynard, Mass.: Digital Equipment Corporation, 1965. Original printed wrappers. OOC 569. -- DIGITAL EQUIPMENT CORPORATION. Symbolic tape editor. Maynard, Mass.: Digital Equipment Corporation, 1965. Original printed wrappers. OOC 570. For more detailed information on these items see Hook & Norman, Origins of Cyberspace.
data.text:
The Origins of Cyberspace collection described as lots 1-255 will first be offered as a single lot, subject to a reserve price. If this price is not reached, the collection will be immediately offered as individual lots as described in the catalogue as lots 1-255.
